result.execSummary:
The defendant Joey GOLDEN Sr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. On one or more other charges, Joey GOLDEN Sr. was found not guilty. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Joey GOLDEN Sr. is presumed innocent of the not guilty charges.

  • Joey GOLDEN Sr. was found guilty of Possess Cocaine w/Intent to deliver (<=1g) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(cm)1g.
  • Joey GOLDEN Sr. was found guilty of Possess THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to the prison sentence imposed on count 3, to commence upon defendant's discharge date after extended supervision ends.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Maintain fulltime employment or employment at a level the agent determines is appropriate.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

Maintain absolute sobriety.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

records.addlTxt:
Order Clarifying the Prior Order for Compassionate Release.
Copy of order to DOC and Sheriff.

Order for Compassionate Release
The defendant shall be granted compassionate release from the confinement portion of his prison sentence pursuant to section 302.113(9g) on August 12, 2017, which is a six (6) month reduction.    The remaining portion of confinement (which should equal six (6) months) shall be added to his extended supervision.   
Copy order e-mailed to DOC and sheriff.

Exhibit 1, copy of DCI costs for infirmary.

It is hereby ordered that bond of $15,000.00 personal recognizance and all additional conditions of release in the bond dated May 30, 2014 be reinstated immediately.
Sentencing hearing set for 08-16-16 at 8:30 a.m.

Question #1 from jury.
Question #2 from jury.

Guilty and not guilty verdicts - unsigned.

GUILTY verdicts on possession with intent to deliver cocaine and possession of THC.
NOT GUILTY verdict on maintaining a drug trafficking place.

Exhibit #5A - Redacted copy of Tracy Zipperer's statement that was given to the jury.
Exhibit #7A - Paper copy of photographs of DVD for court file that was given to jury.

JURY TRIAL - DAY TWO
Exhibits #5A and 7A, marked.
The defendant is found GUILTY of possession with intent to deliver cocaine and possession of THC by the jury.
The defendant is found NOT GUILTY of maintaining a drug trafficking place by the jury.
State moves for judgments on the verdicts.
The Court receives the verdicts and grants the State's motion subject to any post-judgment motions that may be made.
Court revokes defendant's bail and remands defendant in to custody.  
Court orders a Pre-Sentence Investigation to be completed by DOC.  Report to be filed by 07-31-16.

Attorney Fenton wishes to be heard on on the bail revocation and gives argument.
Court denies the motion.
Attorney LaBre wants to put on the record that this is a 2nd and subsequent offense for the defendant.  He has been convicted in 96 CF 322, 96 CM 16, 98 CF 86 and Sheboygan County Case 00 CF 238.  All of which are drug offenses.
Defendant agrees he has been convicted of those matters.  
The Court finds this is a 2nd or subsequent offense.
Minutes.

(Exhibits #2 (marijuana) and #6 (cocaine) were handed over to Detective Andrew Beck for storage at the Manitowoc County Sheriffs Department.)

Random Listing of Jurors.

The Court is granting the request by both parties for sequestration of all witnesses in this case for jury trial except Investigator Andrew Beck who will be the State's designee and allowed to remain in the courtroom for the entire jury trial.
The Court is granting all of the State's motions in limine except motion 1 which is covered by a separate specific order.

ISSUES PRIOR TO TRIAL-
Attorney LaBre objected to defense motion in limine #5.
Arguments.
Court denies defendants motion in limine regarding the States witness testifying first and signs an Order to that effect.
At the pretrial conference the Court was advised the defense has no objections to the State's motions in limine except as it related to #1.  Court already ruled the State has the right to call witnesses in the order it wishes so that witness is exempt from sequestration and signs an Order to that effect.
Attorney LaBre wanted it put on the record that Mr. Golden did make statements.  Defendant does not wish to have a Miranda-Goodchild hearing.
Exhibit #1 - Stipulation, marked, offered and received.
Defendant agrees to the stipulated facts.
Court accepts the stipulation of the parties.
JURY TRIAL - DAY ONE
Jury selected.
Testimony presented.
Exhibits #1-11 marked, offered and received.

Letter from Attorney LaBre to GLB.
Status conference on June 9, 2016 at 11:15 am.

Stipulation and Order to Amend Bail.
1) It is ordered that the defendant's bond conditions be modified so that he is to report to the Manitowoc County Sheriff's Department three times per week as a condition of bond.
2) The reason for the above stipulation is that the defendant is currently required to report daily.  He has been reporting daily without incident since signing his signature bond on 04-30-14.
3) The parties have agreed to ease the defendant's burden by modifying this condition to being only three times per week.

Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing is set for 06-04-14 at 2:00 p.m.  Defendant asks the Court not to report to jail this Friday, Saturday and Sunday.  State objects.  Court denies the motion.
Minutes.
RE:  Possess THC with intent to deliver as repeater, on 04-29-14.
Affidavit of Investigator Andrew W. Beck, Manitowoc County Sheriff's Department.
At 1:33 p.m. search warrant with return of officer thereon.

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of keeper of drug car, possess cocaine with intent to deliver and possess THC as repeater.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 05-19-14 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $15,000.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that he report to the Manitowoc County Sheriff's Department, daily, by 4:00 p.m., that he have no contact with any known drug dealers or sellers and that he not consume or possess any controlled substance without a valid prescription.  Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
Probable Cause Statement and Judicial Determination.
Minutes.
Search warrant issued.  RE:  1209 S. 10th Street, Manitowoc, WI.
